Real climate controlled Ford LXI High Top Limo Van fully insulated with back up generator. Your hound is safe and comfortable. Husband and Wife Team. Competitive Pricing!
PAL has no set schedule. We base our trips on the locations, times, dates and demands of our clients. In so much as we will only transport a minimal number of pets during any given trip, we ask that you give us as much advance notice so that we can work our schedule around yours.
provides 24-hour and With PAL every effort is made to arrive at a convenient time, schedules may dictate arrival at any hour day or night. Customers are provided with a tentative time for pickups and delivery but these times may change due to situations beyond our control. If there should be any significant change (12 hours or more) you will be called and updated with the revised estimated time of arrival.
You will be provided with a cellular number that we can be reached during transport however we ask that calls to us during transit be kept to a minimum. Updates on your pet will be given daily via email or telephone. We will also notify you within a few hours of reaching your home and throughout the trip should any changes occur.
How do I book a shipment ?
To book a transport a work order must be completed and to guarantee the transport for a flight $400.00 deposit and for ground $300.00 deposit must be provided. A work order includes name, city and phone number of shipper and receiver. Number of dog(s), size, weight, breed and color. Final pricing will be determined based on distance of transport, size of dog and location of pick up and drop off. Multiple dog discounts do apply. Call for pricing.
What does it cost to ship a dog ?
To determine shipping costs you must call Billy and he will provide you with a quote. All quotes are flat rates with no additional fees involved unless a request to land at a international airport. We have not raised our rates for two years but our cost of doing business, fuel and expenses has gone up. In order to provide you with competitive rates all quotes are based off interstate too interstate. Door to Door is more expensive and we have found over the years that most people would prefer to save the money and drive a few miles to meet us at an interstate exit closest to their house for our ground runs. We have also found that door to door is a hassle for people that work for a living. Most people are not home during the day and find it easier to meet near their place of work of close to the interstate or major 4 lane highway for ground
transport for air we provide drop-off at your locale general airport .
Do you coordinate around our work, vacation and holiday schedule for transports ?
We are like UPS or FED EX and it is very difficult to work around your work schedule for pick up and deliveries. You will have to provide a backup plan if you are unavailable during a pick up or drop off. We have tried to work around work schedules, vacations and holiday plans in the past but have found it impossible to coordinate. Have a friend or relative on standby in the event that you cannot make the appointment.
Where do we meet for the drop off or pick up and do you provide door to door?
Pick up and drop offs are usually arranged at interstate exits or off of a major 4 lane highway closest to your house or business. Usually the meeting place is a fast food restaurant, truck stop or gas station. This allows us to keep our rates competitive so that you save money. Remember our rates have not gone up in two years. Diesel has gone up $1.00 in the last year. This also cuts down on the time your dog spends in our van. Most people are more concerned about how long will it take to transport the dog than door to door. We pride ourselves on quick turnaround on deliveries. If we went door to door on every pick up and delivery then that process would add one day to every three days we are on the road. Our guarantee is that we will meet you at a location closer than your local airport thus saving you time and money . We can provide door to door for the disabled, shut ins or emergency situations or private transports if requested. Most of our customers volunteer to meet us to help us out anyway.
We learned that communication is very important and we normally call or text numerous times to update the route and schedule. We also update our schedule on our web site daily. You will find that we are easy to get in touch with while on the road.
NOTE: We pride our self of being on time. Delivery and Pick Up times are not guaranteed until the day before the appointment. Weather, Highway Construction, Accidents and other delays occur and may alter a schedule. Dog Transport is not an exact science . We do provide a rough 10 or so day schedule but normally it changes due to above conditions. During winter months all bets are off and safety concerns are our top priority.
Why should you use ground shipping?
As a breeder for 25 years we had used airline shipping but became disenchanted with dealing with heat restrictions, cold restrictions, cancellations and discrimination. In 2002 we began using ground shipping and found it to be a much easier less traumatic on the pet and less hassle. For us ground shipping is a much better alternative. In some situations airline shipping may be your best option. Our position has always been that ground shipping is an alternative to airline shipping.
Are you a coast to coast transporter?
Yes we do Coast to Coast at this time
Do I need a crate or do you provide crates ?
One of the advantages to ground shipping is that you do not need to buy a crate. Crates now cost from $30 - $100. We provide the crates in our van. Note: You do not receive a crate when the delivery is made. Our crates are of the highest quality and are disinfected after each use.
If my puppy of dog dies in transport will you cover the damages ?
We offer an insurance plan for your puppy or dog while in transport. Please see Pet Insurance! PAL provides up to $1200.00 insurance policy free of charge with a health certificate. Note: We have never had a puppy or dog die while in our transport. Although it is possible death may occur but highly unlikely. We take the utmost care for your dog. We treat your animal as if it was our own! We have 6 years of injury and accident free experience shipping dogs to back up our disclaimer.
How long does it take to transport my dog ?
It depends on the route. We start our route in the New Orleans area. The national average for a transport, according to the U.S.D.A., is 3.5 days. Our goal is to keep your pup or dog in our care as minimal as possible. Our average transport takes 1 to 5 days. Some transports may take up to 5.5 days and in very rare cased 7 days for east coast to west runs. All parties involved will be informed prior to shipping arrangements as to the approximate length of shipping time before any final agreement is made. Normally we will not take on a job if we know in advance it will take more that 7 days while other companies will.
Health Certificate and Rabies Tags ?
While a health certificate does not guarantee that an animal is 100% healthy or free from infectious diseases, it does provide some benefits for not only the shipper but also the receiver of the pet. A licensed veterinarian will not issue a health certificate on an animal that is sick or unhealthy or has been used for fighting. This protects the buyer from getting stuck with a sick pet. It also protects the shipper from boarding a pet that may infect other pets in the van or aircraft. A health certificate also provides clues as to why and when a puppy may have contracted a disease. And lastly health certificates are required for ground shippers by State regulations if a pet is shipped across states lines.
Do you board dogs at your facility ?
We do not board dogs at our Facility.
